headline: Kraft Heinz Backs Off Split To Test US$600m Turnaround Bet
summary: Kraft Heinz (NasdaqGS:KHC) has halted its previously announced plan to split into two separate companies. Instead, the company plans to invest US$600 million into its brands, marketing, and product development as part of a turnaround effort. The shift in focus is led by new CEO Steve Cahillane and targets recent volume pressure and market share challenges. Kraft Heinz, the packaged food group behind Heinz ketchup and Kraft macaroni and cheese, sits at the center of the mature, branded...
